article.title: Unified theory of resonances and bound states in the continuum in Hermitian tight-binding models

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1(a) depicts the transmission coefficient of a three-site system with a BIC at zero transmission energy. What is the key feature in the transmission coefficient that signifies the presence of a BIC?
choices: A sharp peak in the transmission coefficient reaching unity.
A gradual decrease in the transmission coefficient to zero.
Simultaneous presence of a unity-valued resonance and a zero-valued antiresonance.
A flat transmission coefficient across the entire energy range.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (21) presents the transmission coefficient (T) in terms of functions P and Q. What do the real roots of these functions correspond to?
choices: Real roots of P represent BICs, while real roots of Q represent antiresonances.
Real roots of P represent resonances, while real roots of Q represent antiresonances.
Real roots of P represent antiresonances, while real roots of Q represent resonances.
Real roots of both P and Q represent BICs, but with different symmetries.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5(d) shows the transmission coefficient profile for a double chain structure with different values of |τ|. What happens when |τ| is tuned to the specific value where antiresonances coalesce?
choices: The transmission coefficient becomes zero across the entire energy range.
The transmission coefficient shows a broad reflection window with a non-zero minimum.
The transmission coefficient shows a sharp peak at the energy of the coalesced antiresonances.
The transmission coefficient becomes unity across the entire energy range.

multiple_choice_question.text: The article discusses the formation of a BIC as a "ghost phase transition."  What key feature of a second-order phase transition is analogous to the behavior of the system near a BIC?
choices: The system undergoes a continuous change in its ground state.
The system exhibits a discontinuous change in its order parameter.
The system shows a divergent response function near the transition point.
The system\'s symmetry remains unchanged throughout the transition.
